intro: Andinia mongei, commonly known as the Mongolian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by insects. Andinia mongei is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
